definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit

sentences.english: No scampering or scurrying. Understand, Little Chef?
sentences.chinese: 不許上下亂竄，懂嗎，小廚子？

sentences.english: Youareslower than a herd of turtles stampeding through peanut butter.
sentences.chinese: 你的速度比一羣在花生醬上亂竄的烏龜還慢。

sentences.english: Jin Qijing pretends not to notice the rat scurrying across the pipe in her room.
sentences.chinese: 金錦奇假裝沒有注意到在她家的管道里亂竄的老鼠。

sentences.english: But the lazy fox went about hungry the whole winter.
sentences.chinese: 而懶惰的狐狸這一冬天都要飢腸轆轆地到處亂竄了。

sentences.english: The monkey is beating up and down.
Don't go around with that gang or you'll come to no good.
sentences.chinese: 不要跟那夥人亂竄，那不會有好下場的。

sentences.english: You are slower than a herd of turtles stampeding through peanut butter.
sentences.chinese: 你比一羣在花生醬中亂竄的海龜還要慢。

sentences.english: Your mind may jump during the meditation initially. ("Am I breathing right?"
sentences.chinese: 冥想開始時你的頭腦可能上下亂竄。

sentences.english: The fishes thrashed about in the net.
Mangano. 'They bang around among the healthy cells and kill or injure them.
sentences.chinese: 它們在健康的細胞間亂竄，會殺死或危害健康細胞。

sentences.english: The dog began to career about the house as soon as the doorbell rang.
sentences.chinese: 門鈴一響，狗就開始在家裏到處亂竄。

sentences.english: They began to run about the garden.
sentences.chinese: 它們開始在園子裏到處亂竄。

definition: lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to be unable to move a single step
to run away/to flee in disarray
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
head and face filthy with grime (idiom)/covered in dirt/dejected and depressed
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
